name: Takun J
description: '''Jonathan Koffa''' (born May 14, 1981), known professionally as '''Takun J''', is a [[Liberia]]n rapper, singer, songwriter, and activist. He is regarded as one of the pioneers of [[hipco]], a [[Music and politics|politically charged]] music genre. The Liberian Gender Ministry designated him as one of its anti-rape ambassadors. Takun J's music addresses [[socio-political]] issues in Liberia. He is best known for the singles "Who Make You Cry", "Police Man", "Gbagba is Corruption", and "A Song for Hawa". Takun J's debut studio album, ''The Time'', was released in 2007. His second studio album, ''My Way'', was released in December 2012. Takun J is the recipient of several accolades, including Male Artist of the Year and Hipco Artist of the Year at the 2014 [[Liberia Music Awards]].
